content:
Diagnosis:

Treatment:

Mar 23 Right breast invasive ductal carcinoma, 28mm primary lesion with extensive intraductal component (35mm), presence of lymphovascular space invasion

ER 0%, PR 0%, HER2 3+ on immunohistochemistry

20.03.23 Axillary node biopsy positive (3/15 nodes involved)

Initial staging workup negative for distant metastatic disease

Mar 23 Right mastectomy with axillary clearance

Apr 23 Commenced on dose-dense AC-T protocol (4 cycles dose-dense adriamycin/cyclophosphamide followed by 4 cycles of weekly paclitaxel)

May 23 Developed grade 4 neutropenia after cycle 2 AC,
commenced on pegfilgrastim prophylaxis for subsequent cycles

Paclitaxel initiated at standard dose but reduced to 75% from week 2 due to
grade 3 peripheral neuropathy and grade 2 hepatic dysfunction
12.07.23 Completed systemic therapy

15.08.23 Completed course of chest wall radiotherapy

Current situation: | Jul 23 Screened for KATHERINE-2 protocol but ineligible due to baseline

cardiac ejection fraction of 51% (protocol requirement >55%)

20.07.23 Initiated adjuvant trastuzumab therapy

10.08.23 Surveillance CT imaging showed post-surgical changes only
25.08.23 Isotope bone scan demonstrated focal uptake in T11 vertebra

10.09.23 Spine MRI showed degenerative disc disease at T11/12 with
moderate foraminal stenosis, no evidence of metastatic involvement. Widespread
osteoporotic changes noted

15.09.23 DEXA scanning confirmed severe osteoporosis (T-score -3.4 at lumbar spine)

Initiating monthly zoledronic acid therapy
Maintaining adjuvant trastuzumab treatment
Due for cycle 5 of planned 17 cycles
30.09.23 Scheduled for cardiac monitoring and surveillance imaging

I saw [redacted name] in clinic today. She describes persistent grade 2 sensory neuropathy affecting her hands and chronic fatigue syndrome. Her cardiac function is stable with no clinical evidence of cardiac dysfunction.

[redacted name] is managing well with cycle 5 of adjuvant trastuzumab and will undergo repeat cardiac assessment on 30 September 2023 alongside planned CT evaluation. We will coordinate concurrent mammographic assessment.

[redacted name] will return to clinic after completion of these investigations to review results and discuss ongoing management strategy.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: 28mm invasive ductal carcinoma with extensive intraductal component (35mm), lymphovascular space invasion present

cancer_timeline.value: Right mastectomy with axillary clearance - 3/15 nodes positive
Commenced on dose-dense AC-T protocol (4 cycles dose-dense adriamycin/cyclophosphamide followed by 4 cycles of weekly paclitaxel)
Developed grade 4 neutropenia after cycle 2 AC, commenced on pegfilgrastim prophylaxis
Paclitaxel reduced to 75% due to grade 3 peripheral neuropathy and grade 2 hepatic dysfunction
Completed course of chest wall radiotherapy
Screened for KATHERINE-2 protocol but ineligible due to baseline cardiac ejection fraction of 51%
Surveillance CT imaging showed post-surgical changes only
Isotope bone scan demonstrated focal uptake in T11 vertebra
Spine MRI showed degenerative disc disease at T11/12 with moderate foraminal stenosis, no evidence of metastatic involvement, widespread osteoporotic changes
DEXA scanning confirmed severe osteoporosis (T-score -3.4 at lumbar spine)

patient_facts.value: cardiac function is stable with no clinical evidence of cardiac dysfunction

status_updates.value: HER2-positive breast cancer treated with mastectomy, adjuvant chemotherapy and radiotherapy, now on maintenance trastuzumab. Patient tolerating cycle 5/17 of adjuvant trastuzumab with stable cardiac function, though experiencing persistent chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy.
managing well with cycle 5 of adjuvant trastuzumab
cardiac assessment, CT evaluation and mammographic assessment scheduled for 30.09.23
return to clinic after completion of investigations to review results and discuss ongoing management strategy
